title: How Italy's healthcare staff survived the pandemic
description: Nurses in Italy have been instrumental in helping to fight Covid-19 - but it's taken a heavy toll.

title: CEO Secrets: 'Master every aspect of your business'
description: Windfarm CEO Sarah Merrick says being involved in all areas of her business has paid dividends.

title: Freemasons: Young people 'on waiting lists' to join notoriously secretive society
description: The first report by Freemasons in 300 years shows it is popular with young people.

title: Coronavirus in India: 'My city is under siege from Covid-19'
description: The BBC's Vikas Pandey has called Delhi home for more than a decade - but Covid has changed everything.

title: No sofa, bed, table - people who have to live without furniture
description: In the UK more than two million people experience furniture poverty yet it’s rarely spoken about.

title: Female football fans share experiences of abuse
description: Meliza and Kendall are dedicated football fans but say they experience abuse because of their gender.

title: St Michael's Mount in Cornwall seeks live-in castle officer
description: A love of Cornwall is a must for this job and people who suffer from sea sickness need not apply.

title: Budget: Australia tries to win back women with childcare boost
description: The government's new budget boosts childcare and women's health, but critics say more reform is needed.

title: Israel-Palestinians: Old grievances fuel new fighting
description: Failure to tackle deep-seated issues meant fresh violence between the two sides was a matter of time.

title: Vesuvius ancient eruption rescuer identified at Herculaneum, says expert
description: A body found at Herculaneum may have been part of Pliny the Elder's team sent to rescue residents.

title: Covid in Scotland: Hugging and indoor visits to resume from Monday
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon says the changes will come into effect in most of the country from Monday.

title: Queen carries out first major royal duty since Philip's death
description: The monarch attended the State Opening of Parliament, a month after the death of her husband.

title: Queen's Speech 2021: Key points at-a-glance
description: New laws on housing, animal welfare and elections feature in the government's plans for next year.

title: Voting: Could ID checks affect who participates in elections?
description: The government says it will pass a law requiring identification to vote.

title: FTSE 100 slides amid fears of rising inflation
description: UK, US and Asian markets fall by around 2% amid worries that inflation is set to pick up.

title: Queen's Speech: Government unveils post-Covid recovery plan
description: Boosting jobs and skills are key priorities - but social care reform is not among the 30 new bills.

title: What is conversion therapy and will it be banned?
description: "Abhorrent" practices aimed at changing sexual orientation or gender identity will be banned, but not until further consultation.

title: Russia school shooting: Children and teacher killed in Kazan
description: Seven children and a teacher are killed in a shooting in the Russian city of Kazan, officials say.

title: The Queen's Speech in full
description: Queen Elizabeth ll opens Parliament, setting out the government's plans.

title: Ballymurphy Inquest: Coroner to publish findings
description: A priest and a mother of eight were among 10 people killed in Belfast after an Army operation in 1971.

title: Conversion therapy: Public to be consulted before ban
description: The proposed ban in England and Wales was announced in the Queen's Speech on Tuesday.

title: Giraffes return to Edinburgh Zoo after 15 years
description: Ronnie and Arrow arrived from Woburn Safari Park in Bedfordshire on Tuesday after traveling overnight.

title: Oli McBurnie: Police make arrest over incident filmed on phone
description: A 24-year-old man has been arrested after a video emerged on social media appearing to show Sheffield United striker Oli McBurnie in an altercation with some young men.

title: Fowler in talks over Swindon job
description: Robbie Fowler holds talks with Swindon Town over their managerial vacancy, BBC Radio Wiltshire understands.

title: Jerusalem crisis: Pleas for calm as violence escalates
description: Rocket attacks from Gaza and Israeli air strikes follow days of soaring tensions in Jerusalem.

title: Julia James: Man appears in court charged with PCSO murder
description: Callum Wheeler, 21, from Aylesham, is accused of murdering the police community support officer.

title: MLB: Making a splash! - MLB fan fetches home run ball in Kayak
description: Watch as Jake Cronenworth hits a splash shot with a lucky San Francisco Giants fan retrieving the home run ball in her kayak.

title: Pret a Manger heads to Tesco in battle for new customers
description: The sandwich chain will open cafes in some supermarkets in a bid to reach more people working from home.

title: Golden Globes crisis: Tom Cruise returns awards and NBC drops ceremony
description: Tom Cruise hands back three gongs and the crisis-hit awards are without a broadcaster for next year.

title: Scotland's Lions flanker Watson finds size talk 'frustrating'
description: Scotland flanker Hamish Watson says comments that he is too small to make an impact for the Lions against South Africa are "a tiny bit frustrating".

title: NHS app ready to become vaccine passport next week
description: People will be able to use the app for travel - but only if they have received two vaccine doses.

title: Bob Marley: 40th anniversary of the music pioneer's death
description: The reggae music legend died of cancer in 1981 aged just 36.

title: Westbrook breaks NBA triple-doubles record
description: Washington Wizards' Russell Westbrook breaks Oscar Robertson's NBA record for the most career triple-doubles.

title: The 'high-maintenance extrovert' who knew he would become Man Utd's number one
description: Team-mates and coaches explain how Dean Henderson's unshakeable self-belief meant he always appeared destined for Manchester United's first team.

title: The papers: 'End in sight' but let's 'use common sense'
description: The "biggest step" in England's lockdown easing and the return of hugs leads many of the papers.

title: Northern Ireland abortion: Real lives behind new drama
description: Lola Petticrew plays a pregnant schoolgirl whose mum faces prosecution after buying abortion pills.

title: Brit Awards: Stars descend on London for in-person awards
description: The 4,000-strong live audience at London's O2 Arena will not need social distancing or face masks.
